revealed_symptoms.hyperkeratosis: There's this rough, flaky spot that won’t go away, and sometimes it peels.
revealed_symptoms.color variation: It’s got a bunch of different colors—like brown, black, maybe even some red or blue mixed in.
revealed_symptoms.diameter >6mm: It’s bigger than the eraser on a pencil, and I feel like it’s still growing.
revealed_symptoms.telangiectasia: There are these tiny, spidery red blood vessels around the spot that I didn’t notice before.
revealed_symptoms.pruritus: It’s super itchy sometimes, or feels kind of tingly, like a weird sensation under my skin.
revealed_symptoms.shiny or waxy bump: It looks kinda like a smooth, shiny pimple, but it never pops or goes away.
revealed_symptoms.rapid growth: I swear this mole or bump got bigger really fast, like in just a few weeks.
revealed_symptoms.spontaneous bleeding: Sometimes this spot just starts bleeding out of nowhere, even if I don’t touch it.

hidden_symptoms.ulceration: It’s like a cut or sore that just won’t heal, and sometimes it scabs over but comes right back.
hidden_symptoms.border irregularity: The edges are all jagged, kinda messy, not smooth like my other moles.
hidden_symptoms.asymmetry: One side of this mole looks different from the other, like it's lopsided or uneven.
hidden_symptoms.erythema: The skin around it looks red or puffy, like it’s irritated or reacting to something.

patient_history.content: Hi, I'll be your doctor today. What brings you in?

Well, there's this rough, flaky spot that won’t go away, and sometimes it peels. It’s got a bunch of different colors—like brown, black, maybe even some red or blue mixed in. It’s bigger than the eraser on a pencil, and I feel like it’s still growing. There are these tiny, spidery red blood vessels around the spot that I didn’t notice before. It’s super itchy sometimes, or feels kind of tingly, like a weird sensation under my skin. Also, sometimes this spot just starts bleeding out of nowhere, even if I don’t touch it.
Thank you for providing such a detailed description. To get a better understanding, could you tell me where this spot is located on your body? Also, how long have you noticed this spot?
It's on my back, and I first noticed it a few months ago, but it's changed a lot since then.
Thank you. Has anyone in your family ever had skin cancer? Also, can you tell me about your history of sun exposure, like how often you're in the sun and if you use sunscreen?
No one in my family has had skin cancer, as far as I know. I'm outside a fair amount, but I try to be careful. I don't always remember to use sunscreen, though, especially when it's not super sunny.
Thank you. Could you describe the shape and borders of the spot? Are they smooth and even, or irregular? Also, have there been any recent changes in the bleeding or itching?
The edges are a bit jagged, not smooth like my other moles. The itching comes and goes, but the bleeding has happened a few times recently, even when I haven't scratched it or anything.
Thank you. Could you describe the color changes you've noticed? Also, have you noticed any recent changes in the size of the spot?
It’s got a bunch of different colors—like brown, black, maybe even some red or blue mixed in. And yeah, it seems like it’s gotten bigger really fast, like in just a few weeks.

It’s bigger than the eraser on a pencil, and I feel like it’s still growing. There are these tiny, spidery red blood vessels around the spot that I didn’t notice before. It’s super itchy sometimes, or feels kind of tingly, like a weird sensation under my skin. Also, sometimes this spot just starts bleeding out of nowhere, even if I don’t touch it.
